The Betaab Valley is popular amongst trekkers as it serves as a base camp for numerous treks that go further into the mountains. The water is used by the locals for drinking, it is that clear! The stream running through the valley is the perfect picnic spot for the day.

destinations.name: Martand sun Temple
destinations.description: Situated in Martand, the Sun temple is said to have been built in the era of the Pandavas. It is around 64 km away from Srinagar and is situated on a plateau. The temple is well known for the carvings on the walls and because it is on a high level, it offers a majestic view of the Mattan village. The Sun temple is a must visit as it is an integral part of the history and heritage of the area.

destinations.name: Mamaleshwar Temple
destinations.description: Mamaleshwar Temple is one of the oldest temples in Pahalgam. It was sanctioned to be built by King Jayasimha next to the banks of river Lidder. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is located just 1km away from Pahalgam You can visit this temple on foot and witness the divine Shiva Lingam and take in the sheer serenity of the temple.

destinations.name: Pahalgam golf course
destinations.description: Pahalgam golf course is famous for its picturesque surrounding and wonderful greenery. The entry fee is nominal and the course is very well maintained. So, grab a camera and head to Pahalgam golf course to capture the majestic beauty of greenery till the eyes can see.

destinations.name: Sanasar lake
destinations.description: Sarasar Lake  is one of the most preferred picnic spots of the region. The lush greenery surrounding the lake adds to the overall beauty. To spend some peaceful time, this is the best place to be. You can take a pony ride close to the lake or can enjoy nature walks.

destinations.name: Billo ki Powri
destinations.description: A staircase of 270 steps chiseled out of the mountain, a little away from Patnitop is known by the name of Billoo ki Powri and falls in the town of Dawariyai.

destinations.name: Nathatop
destinations.description: One reaches Nathatop after a short trek from Patnitop. The hill station is covered with snow during winters thereby enhancing its beauty two times. One can happily go skiing in these mountains. Nathatop has become very famous for its paragliding

destinations.name: Naag Temple
destinations.description: The Nag (Cobra) Temple near Patnitop is more than 600 years old. During the Nag Panchami Festival, it sees hundreds of Shiva devotees, who throng to this temple to pay respects and worship the snake King Cobra.

destinations.name: Skyview Patnitop
destinations.description: One Destination, Endless Experiences A new magical destination in motion brings you a perfect blend of indoor and outdoor activities channeled into uniquely enriching and incredibly fun - modern adventure experiences.

destinations.name: Shikara Ride- Dal Lake
destinations.description: The paramount reason why people come to Srinagar is for the relaxing and memorable Shikara rides. Taking the ride across the scenic Dal Lake at the backdrop of the majestic slow clad Himalaya's is indeed an experience in itself both enjoyable and unparallel.

destinations.name: Shalimar Bagh
destinations.timings:
April to October:
	9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
November to March:
	10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
destinations.description: Shalimar Bagh is a beautifully laid out Mughal garden, the largest of the three Mughal gardens in Srinagar (the other two being Nishat Bagh and Chashme Shahi). This pristine attraction was built in the year 1619 by the Mughal emperor Jahangir for his beloved wife Nur Jahan and lies overlooking the scintillating waters of the Dal Lake. It is now a public park and is known as the 'crown of Srinagar'.

destinations.name: Nishat Bagh
destinations.description: The Nishat Bagh is a 12 terraced garden located near Srinagar's famous Dal Lake. It is the second-largest Mughal garden in Kashmir after Shalimar Bagh. Popularly known as 'Garden of Bliss', it has a splendid Mughal central water channel with several fountains, which is surrounded by tall Chinar trees.

destinations.name: Chashme Shahi
destinations.description: Chashme Shahi is one of the three Mughal gardens in Srinagar, located in the Zabarwan range overlooking the Dal Lake. Also known as Chashma-i-Shahi, it was built 1632 AD by Ali Marda Khan on the orders of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan for his eldest son Dara Shikoh.

destinations.name: HazratBal Dargah
destinations.description: The Hazratbal Shrine in Srinagar is the holiest Muslim shrine and mosque in Kashmir, located on the banks of the Dal Lake. The silvery-white mosque houses a relic known as Moi-e-Muqqadas which is believed to be a sacred hair of Prophet Muhammad's beard.

destinations.name: Tulip Garden
destinations.description: Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden is the largest tulip garden in Asia which is set in the foothills of the Zabarwan mountain range in Srinagar.The Tulip Garden is home to flowers like roses, daffodils, hyacinths, iris amongst 48 varieties of tulips. The Tulip Festival held here is the highlight which attracts tourists from the world over.
destinations.tickets:
Rs.50 for Adult
Rs.25 for Child

destinations.name: Shankaracharya Temple
destinations.description: The Shankaracharya Temple in Srinagar, located on top of the Shankaracharya Hill, is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the oldest shrines in Kashmir. Also known as Jyesteshwara Temple, the temple is named after the great philosopher Shankaracharya who is believed to have visited Srinagar about ten centuries ago. The Shiva Linga he worshipped is located in the temple.
destinations.timings:
7:00 AM - 8:00 P
Cars are not permitted after 5:00 PM

destinations.name: Jamia Masjid
destinations.description: Jamia Masjid is a 600-year-old mosque in Srinagar, located in the Nowhatta area amidst the bustle of local bazaaRs.The tranquil mosque is known for its unique architecture, the highlight being the 378 wooden Deodar pillaRs.The mosque becomes especially crowded on Fridays. The fountain inside the mosque premise is used for ablution or wadu.

destinations.name: Pari Mahal
destinations.description: Pari Mahal is a seven-terraced garden located above the beautiful Chashme Shahi Gardens near Srinagar. Also called the abode of fairies or the home of angels, the historical monument sits on top of the Zabarwan range overlooking Srinagar and the Dal Lake. The main attraction is the numerous colourful flowers and exotic fruit plantations.
destinations.timings:
Everyday:
	9:30 AM to 5:30 PM
Closed on Friday

destinations.name: Dachigam National Park
destinations.description: With lush green environs, beautiful flora and some of the rarest fauna, Dachigam National Park, in Jammu and Kashmir is a natural treasure. Dachigam stands for 'ten villages', which is kept in memory of the ten village communities that had to be relocated to create the catchment area and the park.

destinations.name: Nehru Garden
destinations.description: Providing the best view of the Dal lake is Nehru Garden, a botanical garden in Srinagar. It was built in 1969 in the memory of Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. The Nehru Garden is popular for housing a collection of rare Kashmiri tropical plants. Other things to see include 15000 ornamental plants and a collection of oak trees.

destinations.name: Chatti Padshahi Gurudwara
destinations.description: Situated right out the Hari Parbat's southern gate in Srinagar, Chatti Padshahi Gurudwara is the most important and probably the largest Sikh gurudwara in all of Kashmir valley. The shrine has a sanctum sanctorum in middle of a large rectangular hall. It also has accomodation facilities and langar food is offered to all visitors every day of the year.

destinations.name: Paragliding in Srinagar
destinations.description: Paragliding is one of the most exciting activities that you can experience in Srinagar. Most of the adventure clubs let you experience the thrills of paragliding. Besides giving you a major adrenaline rush, it also let's you have a gorgeous bird's eye view of the valley below. If you are an adventure junkee, you should especially try this one out.

destinations.name: Thajiwas Glacier
destinations.description: Thajiwas Glacier, located at an altitude of 9,186 feet at a short distance from Sonmarg in Jammu & Kashmir, is enormous and blessed with magnificent beauty. Overlooked by the Thajiwas mountain and surrounded by meadows, conifer trees and frozen lakes, it is one of the most beautiful sights you will ever come across.

destinations.name: Gadsar Lake
destinations.description: Set at a stunning height of 5,000 meters with the breathtaking Himalayas in the backdrop, Gadsar Lake is one of the best places to visit in Sonmarg in April for those who want to witness a frozen paradise.

destinations.name: Gangabal Lake
destinations.description: A cascading river at the foothills of Mount Harmukh, Sonmarg sightseeing is so not complete without including a visit to the mesmerizing Gangabal Lake. Drawing its resources from the natural springs and glaciers, Gangabal Lake is one of the best places to visit in Sonmarg in June for those who're looking forward to enjoy the best of trekking in the heart of Kashmir.

destinations.name: Vishansar Lake
destinations.description: Also known as the 'Lake of Vishnu', the Vishansar Lake is one of those places to visit in Sonmarg which holds a great significance in the cultural heritage of Kashmir. Located at an elevation of about 3,710 meters, it is one of the famous oligotrophic lakes (lakes that contain high amount of oxygen) that one must visit on their Kashmir holiday.

destinations.name: Zoji-La Pass
destinations.description: Located high on the Indian National Highway 1D, Zoji La is one of the highly perched, and dangerous yet thrilling mountain passes in Kashmir. It not only connects Srinagar to Leh but it is one of those thrilling tourist places in Sonmarg that takes you a step closer to the Himalayas.

destinations.name: Yusmarg
destinations.description: Set at an altitude of about 7,500 ft. and located in the heart of Pir Panjal mountain range, Yusmarg is undoubtedly one of the best places to visit near Sonmarg. Much famed as the 'Meadow of Jesus', Yusmarg is the place to be for those who just want to be surrounded by all the peace and quiet at a far away place.

destinations.name: Nilagrad River
destinations.description: Considered to be a revered highly in the state of Kashmir for having miraculous healing powers, Nilagrad River is one of the most fascinating places to see in Sonmarg. High on nature and medicinal benefits, no place is close to heaven as much as Nilagrad River is.
destinations.timings:
24 hours
Best time to visit:
	9:00 AM to 12:00 PM

destinations.name: Dal Madol
destinations.description: Dal Modal is a historical attraction in Manipur. It is basically a cannon which was constructed by the King, Raja Gopal Singh to fight the Maratha Invasion. This historical cannon is 3.8 meters long and also has a barrel of 28.5 centimeters. One of the most interesting things about Dal Modal is that even though it is made up of purely iron materials and kept in an open space, it does not rust!
destinations.tickets:
Free Entry
No extra charges for cameras

destinations.name: Loktak Lake
destinations.description: Loktak Lake is the largest fresh water lake in North-East India. It is a beautiful stretch of water resembling a miniature inland sea. A day spent at Loktak Lake is a lifetime of memory. Visitors can catch a bird's eye view of the lake from Sendra. This lake is special because of the bodies of land floating on water. These floating bodies are called 'phumdis' in the local language and they resemble miniature islands. Covering an area of 300 square metres, the lake is a lifeline for many people. It serves as a source of water for hydropower generation, irrigation and drinking water supply in the region and also the source of income for many fishermen. Many say 'Loktak is our mother'.

destinations.name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
destinations.description:
Comprising of approximately 40 square kilometers, the Keibul Lamjao National Park is the world's only 'floating' park with deep vegetation. The park isn't just about the vegetation and the terrain. You can also view the Loktak Lake that is considered to be the largest freshwater lake in India. This National Park is brimming with flora and fauna of diverse species which live in utmost harmony. The best time to visit is between the months of November and February.
Fun Fact: Keibul Lamjao is the home to the endangered Brow-Antlered Deer which is also known as 'Sangai' by the locals in Manipur.

destinations.name: Pancha Ratna Temple
destinations.description: Built by King Raghunath Singha, the temple shouts an ancient architecture and exhibits a cultural richness of those ancient days. At present, Pancha Ratna is technically not serving as a temple, but a preserved heritage site in Manipur. The temple attracts oodles of travellers from far and wide that come here to adore the resplendent architectural beauty of this place. The temple is enclosed by an exquisite garden from where one can explore the beauty of this monument because it is not allowed to enter the temple premises. The entire structure of the temple is protected by a rope fencing which helps to preserve the historical grandeur of the Pancha Ratna Temple. The best time to visit is between the months of October and March.

destinations.name: Radha Shyam Temple
destinations.description: Radha Shyam Temple can be traced all the way back to 1758. It was constructed by King Chaitanya Singh and the temple is devoted to Lord Krishna and Goddess Radha. Radha Shyam Temple is dome-shaped and it lies within an enclosure which is surrounded by the boundary wall. Along with its high sacred significance, the temple is known for its aesthetic architecture which makes a popular tourist attraction in Bishnupur.

destinations.name: Rasmancha Temple
destinations.description: Apart from being only one of its kind in the country, Rasmancha is also one of the oldest brick temples in India. Although at present, the temple does not serve as a temple, instead, it has now become one of the top heritage sites in Manipur. Rasmancha boasts a unique architectural design that makes it the only such monument in India. Ramancha Temple is constructed with red bricks in the form pyramid summit which lies on an elevated platform. Rasmancha remains open throughout the year, despite this, the best time to visit is between the months of October and March.

destinations.name: Susunia Pahar
destinations.description: For all the nature lovers, Susunia Pahar is a perfect escape from the chaos of city life. The entire hill of Susunia is blessed with the eternal natural beauty which includes beautiful shrubs, imposing trees, and medicinal plants as well. The hill is an ideal destination for all the adventure lovers, especially those who love to trek and hike. Another attraction of this place is an ancient monolith which is known as the Narsingha Stone. This stone is located at a place where the spring water is pouring out from a stone gargoyle. The best time to visit Susunia Hill is from October to March.

destinations.name: Moreh
destinations.description: On the India-Myanmar border, Moreh is a commercial hub of Manipur and is often touted as India's Gateway to South-East. The city is known for its exquisite natural beauty and the calm surrounding that make it a popular tourist attraction in Manipur. Other than this, the place is famed for its cultural diversity. Along with the Kuki, Chin, Mizo and Burmese, Moreh also has a significant population of Punjabis, Tamil, Meities, Telugu, Marwaris, Pangals, and Nagas. The city of Moreh can be visited any time during the year. However, the best time to visit Moreh is winter.

destinations.name: Tengnoupal
destinations.description: Tengnoupal is a hill station which is engirdled by the imposing mountains and blessed by the beautiful meadows and valleys. Lying at the highest point of India-Myanmar road in Chandel district, Tengnoupal is a perfect to adore the enduring natural beauty and spend some day in the lap of the mother nature. From this hill station, one can savour the exotic vistas of the entire Manipur Valley. Apart from proffering a bird's eye view of the valley, you can also expect to treat your eyes with some alluring views of serene lakes. The months from October to March are considered the best time to visit Tengnoupal. Summer is also an ideal time to visit the place.

destinations.name: Yangoupokpi Lokchao Wildlife Sanctuary
destinations.description: Sprawling over a large area of 185 sq km, Yangoupokpi-Lokchao Wildlife Sanctuary is reckoned to be one of the nine Important Bird Areas in Manipur. For wildlife buffs, this wildlife sanctuary in Manipur boasts a large variety of wildlife species, both flora and fauna. Currently, Yangoupokpi-Lokchao Wildlife Sanctuary has 29 species of reptiles, 42 mammalian species, 6 species of amphibians, 86 species of fishes and 74 species of avifauna. Winter is the best time to visit this Wildlife Sanctuary.

destinations.name: Khuga Dam
destinations.description: Khuga Dam is a beautiful location for a perfect day out. Built over an artificial lake, the dam serves as one of the major sightseeing places. Initially, Khuga Dam was initially created with a purpose to generate electricity and water supply, however, with time, it became a prime picnic spot. Throughout the year, oodles of tourists, both locals as well as those from other states, flock to this place just to feast their eyes on the sublime beauty that surrounds the dam. Both Winter and Summer are a good time to visit Khuga Dam.

destinations.name: Ngaloi Waterfalls
destinations.description: Amidst the lush greenery and beautiful sceneries of the Ngaloi village, Ngaloi Falls is endorsed as one of the most sought-after tourist attractions in Churachandpur. The sublime view of gushing water cascading from a distant height with the imposing mountains and valleys makes a perfect backdrop. Along with the view, the sound of the water gushing down the rocks blows away your mind. To make things even better, the trip to Ngaloi Waterfalls is not challenging at all. The best time to visit is during Winter, but beware of the cold water!

destinations.name: Tipaimukh
destinations.description: Tipaimukh is a hill station bordering the state of Mizoram. The name Tipaimukh derives from two words 'Tipai' which refers to the Tuivai River and 'Mukh', a local word which means the mouth. Tipaimukh is one of the top nature-blessed tourist attractions in Churachandpur district. Along with its pristine nature, refreshing landscapes and serene ambiance, the town of Tipaimukh is also known as the place where the confluence of Tuivai and Barak rivers takes place. The stunning sight of this convergence is well complemented by the luxuriant hills in the backdrop. You can also take a stroll along the riverbank or go for a boat ride, Either way, a mesmerizing scenic beauty awaits to astound you.

destinations.name: Tonglon Cave
destinations.description: Tonglon Cave is a natural attraction, and amongst the renowned tourist attractions in Churachandpur. In the cave, there are sculptures and carvings that take you back to what must be the time of early settlements at the region. This cave serves a great importance to archaeologists as it aids them in tracing the history of culture of the area

destinations.name: Tuibuong Tribal Museum
destinations.description: This museum takes you on a historical tour of the magnificent past of Manipur and its inhabitants. It gives you a glimpse into the time of erstwhile Kingdom of Manipur to the days when the entire country was ruled by Britishers and to the history of the post-independent era. Tuibuong Tribal Museum boasts some of the rarest and the finest collections that were a significant a part of the traditional and ancient Manipur. In the display, you can see antiques of tribal humans of the region, the tribal costumes, artefacts made up of bamboo and cane and much more. This museum will give you a look into the rich, traditional and cultural legacy of Manipur.

destinations.name: Andro Fire Place
destinations.description: Andro Village offers you the perfect village getaway complete with traditional rural houses and roads. Within the Andro village, lies the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. A never-ending fire since 1st Century AD! Inside the Chakpa Panam Ningthou Meithouirel Shanglen temple, a fire is situated at the center of the premises and has never stopped burning since then. Due to rules of no photography nor sunlight, a shroud of mystery lies over the temple. The fire is said to be sacred and is tend to by the priests inside.

destinations.name: Baruni Hill
destinations.description: Baruni Hill or Nongmaiching Hill or Selloi Langmai Hill is a hill range in Manipur and is the abode of Lord Lainingthou Nongpok Ningthou and his consort Panthoibi in Manipuri mythology. This hill is one of the most important pilgrimage sites for followers of Sanamahi faith in the entire North East India. The Hill is best known for the adventure activities including mountain hiking and mountain climbing. Another feature of the hill is Sanmahi Kiyong Temple which at the top of the hill. It is a temple of Kanglei deity Lord Lainingthou Sanamahi. The best time to visit this temple is when the annual festival of Manipur Cheiraoba is celebrated with great cultural pomp.

destinations.name: Bihu Loukon
destinations.description: Bihu Loukon is an ancient star shaped mud fort located at Maklang, Imphal West in the Manipur state of North-Eastern India. The mud ramparts are approximately about 15 feet thick and about 5 feet in height. The mud ramparts have been there since ancient times and though much of the ramparts of the outer barrier has eroded with time, the fort has remained in a much better condition. The design of the fort can only be recognised at star-shaped from satellite imagery and not from ground-view perspective.

destinations.name: Jama Mosque
destinations.description: Situated on the banks of the Nambul River in Imphal, the Jama Masjid is well constructed and invites the attention of people coming from different parts of the world with it's grandeur and magnificent domes. This mosque has the capacity to house a large gathering for daily prayer. Visiting Jama Masjid during festivals like Eid-Ul-Fitr and Eid-Ul-Zuha would help you get an an experience and get filled up with a sense of holiness.

destinations.name: Kaina Hill
destinations.description: Located amidst the verdant hills of Manipur's Yairipok area, Kaina Temple is perched atop a hill at an elevation of 914 m. The temple complex houses a large hall in the middle surrounded by smaller temples dedicated to different Hindu deities. Legend has it that an idol of Shree Shree Govindajee was created using a Jackfruit Tree from Kaina, after the then-King had a vision from God. This is the reason why the Vaishnavites consider Kaina a holy place. Kaina is also famed for the traditional dance form of Ras Gharba, which is performed during important festivals and ceremonies. A visit to the temple provides a great opportunity to get an insight into the culture, traditions and beliefs of the locals. The picturesque beauty of the surroundings and the temple's peaceful environment makes it a place worth visiting.

destinations.name: Kangla Fort
destinations.description: Located in the heart of the capital city of Manipur - Imphal, Kangla Fort was the seat of kingly governance of the Manipuri Royals, up until the fort was overrun by the British. Kangla Fort depicts the rich history and speaks proudly of it's culture and traditions. The fort is considered to be the best for the history buffs and art lovers as the Kangla Fort holds immense historical, religious and archaeological importance.

destinations.name: Shree Govindajee Temple
destinations.description: Shree Govindajee Temple is the shining golden building that attracts many tourists besides the regular devotees. Being one of the prime attractions of Manipur the temple has the deities of Hindu gods, Radha and Krishna Govinda. Visiting the temple, one could witness the appealing architecture which comprised red brick and boasts of a rectangular medieval style architecture. Right on the entrance of the temple there is a passage that leads to the hall of the main statues. The place is considered to be holy and is visited by the pilgrims who are in search of sanctity.

destinations.name: Sirohi National Park
destinations.description: Covering an area of approximately 41 square kilometers, the Sirohi National Park was previously a forest reserve and later was established a National Park in the year 1982. The reason why the place holds a great significance is because of the natural habitat of the Sirohi Lily which is found here in it's natural state. Some of the animal species found in this region are Wild Boar, Tiger, Leopard and Deer and several other Antelopes. In a nutshell, the Sirohi National Park offers an undisturbed ecosystem to the wild life, making it one of the most visited tourist attractions in Imphal.

destinations.name: Dzukou Valley
destinations.description: Dotted with lush green forests, gorgeous valleys, crystal clear water and sedating ambiance, Dzukou Valley is said to be an epitome of eternal beauty. Situated on the border of Nagaland and Manipur, Dzukou Valley is a paradise of exquisite landscapes that consist of the misty clouds and gorgeous valleys. Throughout the year, this place welcomes tourists and spellbinds them with its enduring grandeur. However, what catches the eyes of tourists most are the countless seasonal flowers that take the exquisiteness of this places to a different level in summer; the views of which is mind-boggling in itself. Since Dzukou Valley is enclosed by the imposing Japfu hill ranges, the place is also an ideal destination for those adventurers who love to break a sweat through hiking and trekking.

destinations.name: Makhel Caves
destinations.description: These caves are considered to be highly sacred amongst the folks of Manipur and Nagaland. As per the legend associated with this beautiful tourist attraction, this is the place from where the Naga community originates and migrated to other places. Not just this, the Banyan trees in the region are also considered sacred because, the locals believe that these trees emerged from the tomb of Naga Mother. Between October and June is a good time to visit.

destinations.name: Mao
destinations.description:
Brimming in culture and history and blessed with tranquillity, Mao is beautiful hill town in the Senapati district. Home to the famous Mao tribe of Nagaland, Mao is one of the busiest commercial towns in Manipur. Renowned for its beautiful location, lively shopping markets and enthralling attractions, Mao is evidently the most talked-about tourist destination in Senapati district. With its natural grandeur, enchanting waterfalls and dreamy landscapes, the hill town of Mao has become a must-visit attraction in Manipur for people of all ages. While spending a vacation here, you can binge on the gardens of orchids, lilies and more floral species. Also, the town of Mao also hosts an annual Cherry Blossom Festival which is celebrated in the month of November.
Fun Fact: Apart from the natural beauty, this place is also very much famed for Naga King Chilli which is considered as one of the 'Hottest Chillies in the World'.

destinations.name: Sadu Chiru Waterfall
destinations.description: Also known as the Leimaram Waterfall, Sadu Chiru is a tourist place of scenic beauty. Cascading from a height of nearly 300 meters, this waterfall makes an enthralling sight for tourists to savour. The mist emerging from the water that disperses in the surrounding is something that conjures up the images of serenity. The route to the falls initially cuts through the forest and foliage and finally a climb up stone steps. However, all the efforts to reach this beautiful tourist destination in Senapati are worthy enough to relish the exquisite beauty of Sadu Chiru Waterfall. En route there are affluent crop fields and small streams that add a unique charm in the pathway. The best time to visit would be between the months of October and March.

destinations.name: Yangkhullen
destinations.description: Yangkhullen is a small town in Senapati district in Manipur which is famous for its natural beauty, historical past and magnificent traditions. Lying on a steep cliff, Yangkhullen is surrounded by mesmerizing landscapes that make it one of the popular places of tourist interest. Moreover, the entire valley that surrounds the place offers some enthralling sights that are definitely a treat to eyes. . Also, what attracts the tourists' attention the most are the centuries-old culture and traditions that are still observed by the locals of the town. The locals play a significant role in preserving the natural habitat of this beautiful place and letting tourists savour the exquisiteness of this place. Fun Fact: While visiting, you'll be able to catch a glimpse of some rare floral species.

destinations.name: Barak Waterfall
destinations.description: Barak Waterfalls consists of seven other waterfalls that are located at a close range making quite a visual. One can spend quality time by picnicking on the banks of the river and the adventure enthusiasts can go for water sports and rafting. As tourism in Tamenglong is still at the nascent stages, the Barak Waterfall along with the seven other waterfalls have remained untouched by urbanisation, which magnifies the beauty of the falls. At first glimpse, you will come across the aqua green water and sight of the cool water gushing from the hills to the plains. Consider visiting between the months of October and February. But, beware of cold water!
destinations.tickets:
Free Entry
Prices may vary for different activities

destinations.name: Buning Meadow
destinations.description: Buning Meadow which is also known as N-piulong Valley is a place coloured with beautiful lilies and orchids all over. One can witness how the beauty of the place is complemented by the multitudes of birds and animals including Hoolock, gibbons and foxes. Also, it can be said that the Bunning Meadow is a spectacle of a flora and fauna that are sure not to be found anywhere else. Consider visiting during the summer months, that is, between March and June.

destinations.name: Kisha Khou
destinations.description: Kisha Khou is a magnificent mountain where one can experience some breath-taking views of the valley and the other peaks in the area. It is covered with dense vegetation and rich in different varieties of flora and fauna. Unlike many other peaks, Mt. Kisa has still been able to preserve its wild feel which makes it a perfect destination for an adventurous trip, such as mountaineering, trekking, etc. Since the mountain range is not frequented by human beings for reason of inaccessibility, it remains to be the home to innumerable rare species of flora and fauna including Horn Bill, Chimpanzee, wild garlic, etc. Fun Fact: The legendary Naga revolutionary leader, Rani Gaidinliu took refuge amidst the rock caves of this precipice when she was pursued by the Britishers.
destinations.tickets: Prices may vary based on activity selected

destinations.name: Tharon Cave
destinations.description: Tharon Cave is a 655.6 meters long, mystical cave comprising of 12 different caves inside. This cave is very friendly. On visiting the cave, you can find a map which is engraved and painted on the stone outside the cave which makes it easier to explore the cave from inside. All the more the map assists in locating each and every nook and turn inside the cave and also figure out the alleyways inside. The best time to visit Tharon Cave is between the months of January and March.

destinations.name: Zeilad Lake
destinations.description: Situated on a high platform up on the hill, the Zielad Lake is noted for its picturesque location and abundant scope for adventure. There are many pythons, fish, tortoises and water birds that have made the Zeilad Lake their home. Many migratory birds also come here every day, which adds to the scenic beauty of the lake.

destinations.name: Khongjom War Memorial
destinations.description: Khongjom War Memorial is a historical attraction located on Kheba Hill on Indo-Myanmar road. It reminds the visitors about the war which was held between the locals of Manipur and the British Army in 1891. Specifically, the memorial is dedicated to Major General Paona Brajabashi who martyred while serving for his motherland. Other than this, Khongjom War Memorial also serves as the reminiscent of the brave warriors, the state of Manipur has produced in the past, who fought and are still fighting for their native land. Every year, Khongjom day is celebrated on 23rd April in the memorial complex.

destinations.name: Lousi Lake
destinations.description: Known for the abundant nature in its surrounding, Lousi Lake is a popular tourist place in Thoubal district that attracts a lot of locals as well as tourists, from far and wide, round the year. Here at Lousi Lake, tourists can be seen picnicking or relishing the serene ambiance and natural beauty of the place. Not just for the tourists, the lake is also very much famous amongst geologists because of its distinctive ecosystem. In total, Lousi Lake cover a massive area of 18 sq km and boasts a compelling wetland ecosystem which is the main highlight and also the reason to lure oodles of tourists to this place. Presently, the lake is also serving as a major source of drinking water for the local residents

destinations.name: Khangkhui Cave
destinations.description:
Locally called as the Khangkhui Mangsor, the Khangkhui Cave is a natural limestone cave. Visiting the place, one could see the large sedimentary limestone formations. What makes the cave more interesting are the formed limestones where some appears to be hanging from the ceiling while some growing from the ground offering a very surreal experience. The cave comprises two large chambers and five tunnels. What keeps the visitors excited inside the cave is finding the way out through the darkness of the caves which is a mystical and unique experience in itself.
Fun Fact 1: Khangkhui Cave was used as a shelter by the local people during World War II.
Fun Fact 2: The archaeologists have discovered important artefacts in and around the cave, that dates back to the Palaeolithic culture.

destinations.name: Khayang Peak
destinations.description: With an altitude of 3114 meter above the sea level, the Khayang Peak is the highest in the Ukhrul district. Visiting the peak one could get a complete Kaleidoscopic view of the entire region that gives a complete view of the flowing hills, the winding streams, undulating valleys and the brilliant hamlets. In simple words, the view of the Khayang Peak is just magical. The sight of the sun rising from the peak is something that cannot be expressed in words but only needs to be experienced. For those who aren't visiting Khayang Peak for trekking can hire public transport and go for a long drive to the top of the hill to breathe in the aura of nature. The best time to visit is between the months of March and May.

destinations.name: Khayang Waterfall
destinations.description: Being the biggest waterfall in Ukhrul, The Khayang Waterfalls is also popularly known as the Telly Waterfalls but the locals prefer it calling Khayang. At a height of approximately 745 feet, it appears to be magical to the eyes, mind and soul that slowly cascades down the hills. For the nature lovers, a visit to Khayang is a must as it helps one feel rejuvenated. Also, the place is blessed with thick deciduous vegetation and displays a wide variety of flora and fauna which is truly mesmerising. The Khayang Waterfall is a good place for the ones seeking some adventure activity. One can get indulged in trekking up to the picturesque waterfalls crossing the lush green forest and scintillating rivers. The scenic beauty that appears while going to the waterfall is a feast to the eyes which is indescribable and can only be felt by being there.

destinations.name: Shirui Kashong Peak
destinations.description: Shirui Kashong Peak lies at an altitude of 2,835 m above sea level. This peak is famous for two things - the rivers flowing across Ukhrul and the crevices of the peak and the second one is the Shirui Lilies growing in this place. After the tireless climb up, one gets rewarded by a heavenly view of clouds, that is mesmerising hovering around the dappled towns and villages, lush green and dense and peaceful forests. Other than this, one can even get a view of the rare birds nesting there which includes Blyth's Tragopan, Mrs. Hume's bar-backed pheasant, and more. One thing that needs to be kept in mind is to carry trekking shoes and a raincoat as sudden showers tend to happen when climbing the peak. The best time to visit is between Mid-May and August to witness the Lilies blooming.

destinations.name: Golden Temple
destinations.description: Sri Harmandir Sahib is the official name of the Golden Gurudwara. The Gurudwara is surrounded by a sacred pool called 'sarover'. The complex is the most important pilgrimage site in Sikhism and it is also called Sri Darbar Sahib. One of these buildings in the complex is the Sri Akal Takht, the highest religious authority for Khalsa Sikhs. Another building is the langar, where a free simple vegetarian meal is served to all without any discrimination.

destinations.name: Jallianwala Bagh
destinations.description: Jallianwala Bagh is a historic garden and ‘memorial of national importance’ in Amritsar, India, preserved in the memory of those wounded and killed in the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre that occurred on the site on the festival of Vaisakhi, 13 April 1919. It houses a museum, gallery and a number of memorial structures.

destinations.name: The Partition Museum
destinations.timings:
Tuesday to Sunday:
	10AM to 6:00 PM 
Closed on Mondays, National Holidays
destinations.tickets:
Indian Nationals: Rs. 10
Foreign Nationals: Rs. 250
Children (5 and below): Free
Partition Survivors: Free
destinations.description: The Partition Museum is a public museum located in the town hall in Amritsar, India. The museum aims to become the central repository of stories, materials, and documents related to the post-partition riots that followed the division of British India into two independent countries: India and Pakistan.

destinations.name: Wagah Border
destinations.description: Located at a distance of 22 km from Lahore, Pakistan and 28 km from Amritsar in India, the Wagah Border marks the boundaries between Indian and Pakistani borders, running along the Grand Trunk Road. The Wagah Border Ceremony or the Beating Retreat Ceremony, held every day, is the prime attraction.

destinations.name: Gobindgarh Fort
destinations.description: Gobindgarh Fort is a historic military fort located in the center of the city of Amritsar in the Indian state of Punjab. The Fort was until recently occupied by the army but was opened to the public from 10 February 2017. Today the fort is being developed as a museum and theme park, as a repository of Punjab's history.

destinations.name: Durgiana Temple
destinations.description: Dedicated to Goddess Durga, the Durgiana Temple or as it is popularly known as the Lakshmi Narayan temple is among the most popular places to visit in Amritsar. The temple got its name from the idol of Goddess Durga. Alongside the idol of Goddess Durga, one can also find the idols of Goddess Lakshmi (Goddess of Wealth) and Lord Vishnu (Protector of the world).

destinations.name: Tarn Taran
destinations.description: Tarn Taran is a small district in the state of Punjab and is one of the most popular tourist places in Amritsar. The place is very popular for its gurudwara, Gurudwara Sri Tarn Taran Sahib. The complex of the Gurudwara Sri Tarn Taran Sahib has the biggest Sarovar (pond) among all the other gurudwaras in Amritsar. People from all corners of India visit this place.

destinations.name: Qila Mubarak
destinations.description: Qila Mubarak, is a historical monument in the heart of the city of Bathinda in Punjab, India. It is recognized as monument of national importance and maintained by Archaeological Survey of India. It has been in existence from 1100-1200 AD in its current place and is the oldest surviving fort in India.

destinations.name: Rose Garden
destinations.description: Rose Garden is one of the main attractions in Bathinda. True to its name there are many varieties of roses planted and it is a weekend get away for the residents of the city as well as a morning walk area. It also houses an amphitheater where various performances by artistes can be witnessed free of cost in weekends.

destinations.name: Takht Sri Damdama Sahib
destinations.description: Takht Sri Damdama Sahib was developed as a centre of Sikh learning by Guru Gobind Singh and is considered one of the five Sikh Takhts. The Guru rested here after the battle at Muktsar, earning the place its name which means breathing or resting place. It was here Guru Gobind Singh prepared copies of the Guru Granth Sahib before dispatching them to the other Takhts.

destinations.name: Sukhana Lake
destinations.description: Sukhna Lake is a man-made lake and is the only one of its kind in the city created in the year 1958 by damming the seasonal Sukhna Choe (Stream) that flows down the Shivalik Hills. With its pristine blue water, the lake serves as a perfect location for a stream of morning joggers and walkers who can also enjoy the fresh air

destinations.name: Rock Garden
destinations.description: Started as a hobby by the founder Nek Chand Saini in 1957, the Rock Garden of Chandigarh has now become one of the best tourist places in Chandigarh. Spread in more than 40 acres of seamlessly designed and decorated land, Rock Garden is embellished with more than 5,000 illustrations sculptures. What's more amazing is the fact that everything the place holds is made out of various industrial and urban waste.

destinations.name: Zakir Hussain Rose Garden
destinations.description: Spread across an area of more than 30 acres of land, Zakir Hussain Rose Garden in Chandigarh holds some of the most elegant and fascinating collections of roses from India and the world. The garden is named and formed in the memory of India's former president, Zakir Hussain. Migrating from various parts of the country, a collection of more than 16,00 species of 50,00 rose plantations can be found here.

destinations.name: Terraced Garden
destinations.description: Found in sector 33 of Chandigarh, Terraced Garden is an acknowledged spot, celebrated for its lush collection of vibrant flowers and lanky trees. Founded in the year 1979, the garden is covered in more than 10 acres of land. Since its inception, new and varied species of tropics, shrugs and flowers have been continually added to the area making it one of the most attractive places to visit in Chandigarh.

destinations.name: Elante Mall
destinations.description: Elante Mall is a shopping mall in the city of Chandigarh in India. With the gross leasable area of 1,150,000 sq ft, it is the second largest shopping mall in Northern India and the seventh largest in India. Elante is spread over an area of 20 acres.

destinations.name: ISKCON Temple
destinations.description: Peaceful and religious, the Iskon Temple is one of the greatest places to visit in Chandigarh, especially for the spiritual individuals and devotees of Lord Krishan. From daily poojas to customary celebrations throughout the year, every corner of the temple speaks about purity and devotion towards the lords.
destinations.timings:
Sunday To Thursday:
	4:30 AM - 5:00 AM,
 07:15AM - 12:45PM,
 4:15PM - 8:00 PM.
 Closed on Friday and Saturday

destinations.name: Chhatbir Zoo
destinations.description: This Zoological Park not only boasts about being home to the enchanting Royal Bengal Tiger and the mighty Lions along with other reptiles and mammals but is also famed for the walkways surrounded by lush green forests.

destinations.name: International Dolls Museum
destinations.description: International Dolls Museum was established in the year 1985 by Chandigarh administration in collaboration with the Rotary Club of Chandigarh. The museum is functioning under the guidance of the Indian Council of Child Welfare, Chandigarh. It was set up for the purpose of entertaining the kids. It consists of 250 different kinds of dolls and puppets gathered from different countries like Denmark, Germany, Netherlands, Spain, Russia and Korea etc.
destinations.timings:
10AM to 5:00 PM
Closed on Sundays, National Holidays

destinations.name: Wonderland
destinations.description: If you are adventurous and have a liking for thrilling rides, this is the perfect place for you. Home to some of the most amazingly thrilling and adventurous rides, Wonderland is one of the most popular places to visit in Jalandhar. Groove to some funky Punjabi music and dance under the water showeRs.The theme park has artificial clouds which shower artificial rains. Sometimes, you can see some colourful rains coming from the artificial clouds. Also, the theme park is not open on some winter days as the climate in the city gets very intensely cold.
destinations.tickets:
Rs.900 for Adult
Free entry for children under 3 feet.

destinations.name: Science City
destinations.description: Spread over an area of 72 acres, the Pushpa Gujral Science City is one of the popular tourist places in Jalandhar. A joint project of the Indian Central Government and Punjab Government, this place was built to invite enthusiasts to explore the various fields of life like science, agriculture, technology, engineering, human evolution and many more.
destinations.tickets:
Package I:
Rs.355 for Adults
Rs.265 for Students
Rs.188 for Senior Citizens
Package II:
Rs 425 for Adults
Rs.305 for Students
Rs.233 for Senior Citizens.

destinations.name: Devi Talab Mandir
destinations.description: One of the oldest temples in the state, Devi Talab Mandir is one of the most popular religious places to see in Jalandhar. The origins of the temple belong to the religious scriptures which say that the right breast of Devi Sati had fallen at the location of the temple. Over the years, many foreign invaders tried to capture this temple but they failed to do so.

destinations.name: Niku Park
destinations.description: Nikku Park is the perfect place for a morning jog as one can experience the fresh winds. Also, it is quite popular and the ultimate place to spend an evening at ease. One can eat the famous street food of Jalandhar on the various food stalls located outside Nikku Park. The park has various fun slides and fountains making it a fun place in the city.

destinations.name: Jang-e-Azadi Memorial
destinations.description: Dedicated to the brave hearts of Punjab who lost their lives for India, Jang-e-Azadi memorial is built near the Jalandhar-Amritsar highway in the town of Kartarpur. Spread over an area of 25 acres, this mega project had risen to become one of the top places to visit in Jalandhar. The dome-shaped architecture and the white pale ceilings are astonishing. Do not miss the 15-minute 3D movie in the AV hall of the Memorial where you can see the movie on India's struggle for freedom.
destinations.timings:
Monday to Saturday:
	10:00 AM to 6:00 PM
Sunday:
	7:00 AM to 7:00 PM

destinations.name: Gurudwara Talhan Sahib
destinations.description: Gurudwara Talhan Sahib Ji is located in a small village on the outskirts of Jalandhar named Talhan. It is one of the unique places to visit in Jalandhar because of the devotees who come here offer toy aeroplanes to the deity. The deity in this shrine is of Baba Nihal Singh who was a local in Talhan.

destinations.name: St. Mary's Cathedral
destinations.description: St. Mary's Cathedral is the new church which was built between 1985-1990 replacing the old church which was built in 1847. St. Mary's Cathedral is visited by many locals and  is one of the best places to visit in Jalandhar. In the area around the church, one can find some colourful flowers, lush trees and a big gallery called Rosary Villa which houses some pictures of Jesus and Mother Mary.

destinations.name: Dera Baba Murad Shah Ji
destinations.description: Dera Baba Murad Shah Ji is a Sufiyana Darbar located in Nakodar, Jalandhar Punjab, India. The Darbar is a symbol of love and peace where people from all different castes and religions come and pay their respects at this Darbar.

destinations.name: The Jagatjit Palace
destinations.description: The Jagatjit Palace was once the residence of the Maharaja of the state of Kapurthala, Maharaja Jagatjit Singh. This Indo-Saracenic architecture building is now inhabited by the Sainik School train boys for the National Defense Academy. The palace was built in 1908 and has a distinctive architecture that makes it worth a visit.

destinations.name: Moorish Mosque
destinations.description: The Moorish Mosque, Kapurthala situated in Kapurthala in the Indian State of Punjab is patterned on the lines of the Grand Mosque of Marrakesh, Morocco.[citation needed] It was commissioned by Maharajah Jagatjit Singh, the last ruler of Kapurthala.[1] Kapurthala city, was then the capital city of the Kapurthala State, known as 'Mini Paris of Punjab' and the mosque was stated to be one of the best in South-east Asia.[2]

destinations.name: Shalimar Garden
destinations.description: A beautifully well-laid compact garden with swimming pool and mausoleums of erstwhile rulers of Kapurthala is filled with piece and is a great spot for spending leisure time. The Shalimar Gardens where Maharaja Ranjit Singh and Maharaja Fateh Singh had met. There are also 'Samadhis' of former rulers of Kapurthala State in this historic garden having excellent work on art of them. In addition have a pond, a park & a library.

destinations.name: Phillaur Fort
destinations.description: One of the places in Ludhiana is the historical Phillaur Fort. Deriving its name from Sanghera Jat Phul, this place has been built on European architecture. The place has an extensive moat around it and has 4 bastions on four corners, two watchtowers, tall gates and high wall of 4.7 meters making it an ideal for military operations.
destinations.timings:
Only open on Thursdays
Usually closes at sunset

destinations.name: Gurudwara Shri Manji Sahib
destinations.description: In the Alamgir village lies one of the biggest Sikh religious shrines, the Alamgir Sahib, one of the popular tourist places in Ludhiana. Popularly known as Gurudwara Shri Manji Sahib in memory of the tenth Sikh guru, Guru Govind Singh, this is the place where the guru had shot an arrow in the ground and created a spring of water(Tirsar).
destinations.timings: Open at all hours of the day

destinations.name: Lodhi Fort
destinations.description: On the bank of the river, Sutlej stands the historical marvel - the Lodhi Fort. Built by Sikander Lodhi as his military base 500 years ago, the majestic castle has withstood various natural calamities over the years and is now in ruins but still steals the heart of tourists with its age-old beauty.

destinations.name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Memorial
destinations.description: Located on the GT Road in Ludhiana, Maharaja Ranjit Singh War Museum not only pays homage to the soldiers but also educates the citizens of India about the role of defense. A majestic statue of Maharaja Ranjit Singh sitting proudly on a throne welcomes you as you enter the museum. It has 12 galleries with exhibits of different divisions like the Ancient History Gallery, Post Independence History Gallery, War Hero?s Gallery, Air Force and Navy Gallery etc.
destinations.tickets:
Rs.40 for adults
Rs.20 for children above 5 years
Free for children below 5 years
destinations.timings:
9:30 AM to 5:00 PM
Closed on Monday

destinations.name: Hardy's World
destinations.description: Located on Ludhiana-Jalandhar national highway, Hardy's World is a fun and water park to enjoy with family and friends. Nice and adventurous water rides, swimming pool and restaurant makes the place awesome.

destinations.name: Fateh Burj
destinations.description: Inaugurated in 2011, the Fateh Burj is a minaret located on a battle site and celebrates Sikh warrior Banda Singh Bahadur's victory over the powerful Mughals. With a height of 100 meters, it is the tallest victory memorial in the entire country and boasts an architectural style that showcases many historical influences that shaped the region.
destinations.timings:
10:00 AM to 8:00 PM
Closed on Mondays

destinations.name: Amb Sahib Gurudwara
destinations.description: One of the most visited ones among places in Mohali is the Amb Sahib Gurudwara, dedicated to Guru Har Rai. The pristine white structure stands out of the countryside offering a spectacular sight. One of the striking features of the structure is its pillared corridor with multiple archways at the entrance.

destinations.name: Gurudwara Sant Mandal Angita Sahib
destinations.description: Just 500 meters away from the Amb Sahib Gurudwara is the Gurudwara Sant Mandal Angita Sahib. The three-level structure looks like a splendorous palace from a distance with well-manicured lawns leading up to the building. The milky white marble shimmers in the daylight and five domes complete the roof with a grand flourish.

destinations.name: Thunder Zone Amusement Park
destinations.description: Make a splash on your Mohali trip at Thunder Zone Amusement Park where you can indulge in a thrilling range of water and land rides. This highly-rated amusement park is one of the best places to visit in Mohali with family and has rides specifically designed for the younger ones we well. The park has some regular rides that you can never get tired of, like the Octopus, the Columbus, and the Swinging Chairs.
destinations.tickets:
Amusement Park: Rs. 450
Water Park: Rs. 800
Combo Pack:Rs. 850
destinations.timings:
April to October:
	10:00 AM to 7:00 PM
November to March:
	10:00 AM to 5.30 PM

destinations.name: Mansa Devi Temple
destinations.description: The Mata Mansa Devi Temple is a rather scenic religious get away with the hills of the Siwaliks serving as its backdrop. Built about two centuries ago, the temple is dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi. The temple complex is around 100 acres and there are many structures within, each with a distinctive design and architecture.
destinations.timings:
4:00 AM to 10:00 PM (Summer)
5:00 AM to 9:00 PM (Winter)

destinations.name: Mukteshwar Temple
destinations.description: Mukteshwar Temple is situated atop a hill and contains a marble Shiva lingam and a copper yoni. The idols of the various Hindu deities Brahma, Vishnu, Hanuman, Parvati and Ganesha surround the Lingam.

destinations.name: Nurpur Fort
destinations.description: Nupur fort was formerly known as the Dhameri Fort and was built in the 10th century. The fort was destroyed by the British and then by an earthquake in 1905. The temple inside the fort called Brij Raj Swami was built in the 16th century and is known to be one of the only places where both the idols of Lord Krishna and Meera Bai are worshiped

destinations.name: Ranjit Sagar Dam
destinations.description: The dam is a part of the hydroelectricity project of the state Government of Punjab and was completed in 2001. The Ranjit Sagar Dam is also known as the Thien Dam and constructed on the river Ravi. The dam is a great picnic spot with its lush green surroundings

destinations.name: Shahpurkandi Fort
destinations.description: Built in the 16th century Shahpurkandi Fort is a famous fort in Pathankot. The fort was a strategic military fort which now serves as a rest house for the tourists. It is located at the banks of the River Ravi and provides some amazing views of the city. The fort is located at the confluence of the state of Jammu and Kashmir and Pathankot.

destinations.name: Kathgarh Temple
destinations.description: Kathgarh Temple is dedicated to lord Shiva and Parvati and is characterized by an ancient lingam with mystical origins. The temple was said to have been visited by Bharat during his search for Lord Rama. The temple is located at the confluence of the Beas and the Chonch River. The temple is marvelously built in a roman styled architecture.

destinations.name: Qila Mubarak
destinations.description: The Qila Mubarak complex is a rampart fort cum palace built in Sikh Palace architectural style- a derivative of Mughal and Rajput style of architecture in India.

destinations.name: Kali Mata Mandir
destinations.description: The Kali Devi Mandir at Patiala was built by the Maharaja of Patiala, Bhupinder Singh, in 1936, who was inspired to build the temple and bring the idol of Goddess Kali and the 'paawan jyoti' or the 'sacred fire' from Bengal to Patiala.

destinations.name: Sheesh Mahal
destinations.description: Literally meaning the Palace of Mirrors, Sheesh Mahal was built as a part of the Old Moti Bagh Palace in the 19th century. There are a lot of frescoes, mostly made under the reign of Maharaja Narinder Singh. There is a lake in front of this palace along with a bridge called Lakshman Jhula, which adds to its beauty.
destinations.timings:
Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri:
	10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Sat, Sun:
	10:00 AM - 9:00 PM
Monday Holiday

destinations.name: Gurudwara Dukh Niwaran Sahib
destinations.description: One of the most popular Gurudwaras in Punjab, Gurudwara Dukh Niwan Sahib is a Gurdwara in  Lehal which is now a part of Patiala and is quite famous for curating virtues. Looked after by the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, visitors have faith in the healing qualities of the water here and pay an annual tribute to this Gurdwara.

destinations.name: Moti Bagh Palace
destinations.description: Moti Bagh Palace is a palace in Patiala, also known as Pearl Garden Palace. The word 'Moti' means 'pearl', and 'Bagh' means 'garden'. The Palace was built by Maharaja Narinder Singh, the great-grandfather of Maharaja Bhupinder Singh, in 1847, at a cost of five lakhs of rupees.

destinations.name: Bahadurgarh Fort
destinations.description: Located in the city of Patiala, Bahadurgarh Fort is an ancient historical fort which was constructed in 1658 CE. Originally built by Nawab Saif Khan, it was later renovated and remodelled by Maharaja Karam Singh in 1837.
destinations.timings:
Everyday:
	9:00 AM to 5:00 PM
Monday Closed

destinations.name: Baradari Gardens
destinations.description: Baradari Gardens, located north of Old Patiala city nearby Sheranwala Gate was built during the reign of Maharaja Rajinder Singh. It houses a lot of rare trees, shrubs and flowers along which graces the presence of colonial buildings.

destinations.name: Bir Moti Bagh Wildlife Sanctuary
destinations.description: Located 5 kms from Patiala city, the Bir Moti Bagh Wildlife Sanctuary is spread over 654 hectares of land and was once the royal family's prized hunting reserves. The Bir area was declared a wildlife sanctuary in 1952.

destinations.name: Bhakra Nangal Dam
destinations.description: It is one of the best places to see in Nangal for those looking forward to experiencing the bliss of nature. Being the second-largest dam in Asia, Bhakra Nangal Dam is indeed an important landmark in the history of India. One of the largest man-made wonders, this place attracts plenty of tourists who love to rejuvenate amidst nature.

destinations.name: Nangal Wetlands
destinations.description: Surrounded by canals, beautiful hills and Sutlej river, Nangal wetlands is one of the most famous places to visit in Nangal. This place is very famous due to the establishment of the bhakra dam on the Sutlej river. The 6-km long Nangal lake is absolutely ideal to soothe your mind, body, and soul.

destinations.name: Virasat-E-Khalsa
destinations.description: This museum is located in the holy town of Anandpur Sahib and is one of the best tourist places in Nangal. The attractive museum was built in 1999 by architect Moshe Safdie. It celebrates and honors 300 years of the birth of Khalsa and 500 years of Sikh history.
destinations.tickets: Free. Full day passes at Rs.100

destinations.name: Takht Sri Kesgarh Sahib
destinations.description: Takht Sri Keshgarh Sahib, situated at Anandpur Sahib, is one of the most holy places of the Sikhs. Takht Sri Keshgarh Sahib is the birthplace of the Khalsa. The order of the Khalsa was founded here by Sri Guru Gobind Singh in 1699.

destinations.name: Sheetla Devi Temple
destinations.description: This beautiful temple is situated quite close to Chintpurni. This religious shrine is absolutely famous and attracts many visitors due to its divinity and elegant structure. When you visit Chintpurni temple, you cannot miss out on visiting Sheetla Devi Temple and seek blessings of Sheetla Mata.

destinations.name: Mata Naina Devi
destinations.description: Shri Naina Devi Ji Temple is again one of the amazing places to visit in Rupnagar. This magnificent temple is created from marble that lends an alluring look and feel to it. Furthermore, the silvered doors are carved with elegant figures of the deities. The main door of this temple features pictures of Lord Sun and various other Gods. Among the three stone statues, one of them represents Shri Naina Bhagwati in the form of Pindi with two beautiful eyes.

destinations.name: Jateshwar Mahadev Temple
destinations.description: Jateshwar Mahadev Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is one of the chief worship centres for Hindus in the district. It is located in the Jatwahar village along with the remains of earlier temples at the site that date back to the 10th or 11th century. The shrine was established by an inhabitant of the village, Jai Dayal Sharma.

destinations.name: Kiratpur Sahib
destinations.description: Kiratpur Sahib is the place where the Sikhs submerse the ashes of their dead family members. The town is located on the banks of River Sutlej in Rupnagar District. Kiratpur Sahib has historical connection with Sikh Gurus.

destinations.name: Gurudwara Bhatta Sahib
destinations.description: Gurudwara Bhatta Sahib features several gifts that were presented by Guru Gobind Singh to Pathans. Some of the articles displayed in the shrine are 'kitar', sword and dhal'. Thousands of devotees pay homage in the gurudwara during August, when a fair is organised to commemorate the death of Baba Jiwan Singh.

destinations.name: Chamkaur Sahib Gurudwara
destinations.description: Chamkaur Sahib, located on the banks of Sirhind Canal, is situated nearby Morinda and Rupnagar town. It is believed that Guru Gobind Singh had once visited this town with his 40 followers and 2 sons.

destinations.name: Aam Khas Bagh
destinations.description: Aam Khas Bagh translates to the Garden of the Ordinary (Aam) and privileged (Khas). The present-day Aam Khas Bagh comprises of the remnants of a highway inn that was constructed for the use of royals as well as the ordinary people. It is one of the most visible reminders of Sirhind's glorious past.

destinations.name: Rauza Sharif
destinations.description: Rauza Sharif is also known as Dargah of Shaikh Ahmad Faruqi Sirhindi. He is more popularly known as Mujaddid, Alf Sani. It is a significant site of tourist attraction in Sirhind, owing to its historical importance and architectural beauty.

destinations.name: Floating Restaurant
destinations.description: Known as India's first and foremost floating restaurant, this idea was conceived in Sirhind, Punjab and built in the early seventies. The uniqueness of the concept and its perfect implementation helped it creating national headlines at its time.

destinations.name: Gurudwara Fatehgarh Sahib
destinations.description: Gurudwara Fatehgarh Sahib is a complex comprising of several shrines located in the Town of Sirhind. This place of worship marks the 1710 conquest of this city by the Sikhs under the able leadership of Banda Bahadur.

destinations.name: Mata Chakreshvari Devi Temple
destinations.description: The Mata Chakreshvari Devi Jain Temple is a famous temple of the Goddess Chakreshvari. It is also called the Mata Shri Chakreshvari Devi Jain Tirth. This ancient temple is located in the Attewali village of Sirhind and is believed to be more than a thousand years old.

destinations.name: Haveli Todar Mal
destinations.description: The Haveli Todar Mal is situated within the premises of Gurudwara Fatehgarh Sahib. It was built in the 17th century and is also popularly known as Jahaz Mahal or Jahaz Haveli. The haveli is located in Harnam Nagar, on the eastern side of the Sirhind-Ropar Railway Line.

destinations.name: Gayatri Waterfalls
destinations.description: Gayatri Falls is a beautiful, cascading waterfall over the Kadem River in the Adilabad district of Telangana. These waterfalls are secretly tucked in between the deep woods of the Tarnam Khurd Village. Popular for beautiful scenic views and panoramic vistas, the spot also offers moderate to challenging trekking opportunities and is best visited during monsoons.

destinations.name: Kuntala Waterfalls
destinations.description: Kuntala Waterfalls is hidden from the noisy external world and offers you the best of nature. It is covered with valleys, dense forest, and chirping birds, and the initial sight is like heaven on Earth. To add adventure, you can enjoy trekking though big boulders to reach the footsteps of the waterfalls. One should be careful while climbing to the top, for it is very steep and risky.

destinations.name: Pochera Waterfalls
destinations.description: At a distance of 37 kilometers from the famous town of Nirmal, Pochera Waterfalls stands secluded and untouched by urbanisation in a scenic environment. This tourist spot is for the adventurous because of the depth of the waterfalls. Adding a spiritual touch to the location is the Narasimha Swamy Temple nearby.

destinations.name: Birla Mandir
destinations.description: Birla Mandir is a Hindu temple, built on a 280 feet high hillock called Naubath Pahad on a 13 acres plot. The construction took 10 years and was opened in 1976. The temple was constructed by The Birla Foundation, which has also constructed several similar temples across India, all of which are known as Birla Mandir.

destinations.name: Charminar
destinations.description: The Charminar, constructed in 1591, is a monument and mosque located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. The landmark has become known globally as a symbol of Hyderabad and is listed among the most recognized structures in India.

destinations.name: Chilkur Balaji Temple
destinations.description: Chilkur Balaji Temple is an ancient Hindu temple of Lord Balaji on the banks of Osman Sagar in Hyderabad. It is one of the oldest temples in Hyderabad and the deity present there is most commonly referred to as the VISA God.

destinations.name: Chowmahalla Palace
destinations.description: Chowmahalla Palace is the palace of the Nizams of Hyderabad State in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. It was the seat of the Asaf Jahi dynasty and was the official residence of the Nizams of Hyderabad while they ruled their state. The palace was built by Nizam Salabat Jung.

destinations.name: Durgam Cheruvu
destinations.description:
Located near the city's software hub, Hitech City, Durgam Cheruvu was once open a secret lake. Secluded from man-kind for almost 20 years, it has now developed into picturesque location surrounded by green pastures and scenic hills of the Deccan Plateau. Boat rides, camping, trekking and picnics are some of the activities that take place here. Tourists can also buy a range of apparel, consumer goods and a host of other items at the nearby shopping destination - Inorbit Mall.
FUN FACT: If you're lucky, you might catch some movies being filmed!
destinations.timings:
Monday - Sunday: 9.00 AM - 8.30 PM
Public Holidays: 9.00 AM - 8.30 PM
destinations.tickets:
Free Entry
Rs. 20 per trip for Putty

destinations.name: Falaknuma Palace
destinations.description: The Falaknuma Palace takes you for a walk in the past, retracing the paths of the Nizams and gives you a glimpse into the richness of Indian History. Standing at a height of 2000 feet above the city, tourists and natives all bow down in awe before the splendour and magnificence of the palace.Other than the beauty and historical importance, there is a rich library which contains the rarest of manuscripts.
destinations.timings:
Monday - Friday: 9.00 AM - 6.30 PM
Saturday: 9.00 AM - 6.30 PM
Sunday: 9.00 AM - 6.30 PM
Public Holidays: 9.00 AM - 6.30 PM

Both inclusive of Entry Fee

destinations.name: Golconda Fort
destinations.description: Golconda Fort, also known as Golkonda, is a fortified citadel and an early capital city of the Qutb Shahi dynasty, located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Because of the vicinity of diamond mines, especially Kollur Mine, Golconda flourished as a trade centre of large diamonds, known as the Golconda Diamonds. The region has produced some of the world's most famous diamonds, including the colourless Koh-i-Noor, the blue Hope, the pink Daria-i-Noor, the white Regent, the Dresden Green, and the colourless Orlov, Nizam and Jacob, as well as the now lost diamonds Florentine Yellow, Akbar Shah and Great Mogul.

destinations.name: Hussain Sagar
destinations.description: Hussain Sagar is a heart-shaped lake in Hyderabad, Telangana, built by Ibrahim Quli Qutb Shah in 1563. It is spread across an area of 5.7 square kilometers and is fed by the River Musi. A large monolithic statue of the Gautama Buddha, erected in 1992, stands on Gibraltar Rock in the middle of the lake. It also separates the city centre of Hyderabad from its neighborhood Secunderabad. The maximum depth of the lake is 32 feet. Hussain Sagar is also famous for the Ganesh Nimarjan
destinations.tickets:
Boat Ride:
	Rs. 55 per adult
	Rs. 35 per child

destinations.name: KBR National Park
destinations.description: Named after former Chief Minister Kasu Bramhananda Reddy, KBR National Park is sprawled over an area of about 156 hectares in the lush lanes of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills. Even though Hyderabad has developed into an IT Hub, KBR National Park reminds us of what Hyderabad was before - belonging to Mother Nature.

destinations.name: Keesaragutta Temple
destinations.description:
Keesaragutta is a Hindu Shrine dedicated to Lord Shive and his consorts - Goddesses Bhavani and Sivadurga. Scores of devotees arrive on the day of Shivaratri to pray on the small hill.
Fun Fact: Many Shiva Lingas can be found scattered inside and outside the temple and it is said that Lord Hanuman himself placed those lingas there.

destinations.name: Laad Bazaar
destinations.description: Laad Bazaar is a very old market located in Hyderabad and is very popular for bangles. Stretching to more than a kilometer, Laad Bazaar consists of many shops selling bangles, wedding accessories, sarees, everyday-use jewellery, semi-precious stones, fabrics and the list goes on. To add to it, this bazaar is located in close proximity to landmarks like Charminar, Mecca Masjid and Chowmahalla Palace.
destinations.tickets:
Free Entry
Prices at different stalls may vary

destinations.name: Lumbini Park
destinations.description: Located in the heart of Hyderabad, Lumbini Park is a major attraction on the Tank Bund Road and overlooks the Hussain Sagar Lake. Children and adults are lured here for the peaceful scenery and fun activities. Boating facilities, food joints and other amenities can be accessed. The biggest treat is the Water Fountain which plays tunes of notable songs from Hindi and Telugu films. The musical fountain has 2 shows everyday (7:15 PM and 8:00 PM).

destinations.name: Mecca Masjid
destinations.description: Mecca Masjid is a congregational mosque in Hyderabad, India. It is one of the largest mosques in India with a capacity of 20,000. The mosque was built between the 16th and 17th centuries, and is a state-protected monument situated in the heart of the old city of Hyderabad, close to the historic landmarks of Charminar and Chowmahalla Palace. The entrance to the courtyard is one of the mosque's most striking features with a rectangular, arched, and canopied building that houses the marble graves of the Asaf Jahi dynasty rulers.

destinations.name: Nehru Zoological Park
destinations.description: One of the well maintained, expansive and among the best zoos in Asia, the Nehru Zoological Park is home to more than 1,500 species of birds, animals and reptiles. The major attractions for vistors is the Lion Safari. You will find yourself surrounded by an entirely different world of wild animals such as lions, tigers, rhinos, panthers, etc. The pre-historic dinosaur park is also a must-see. Even though it takes around 6-7 hours to cover the whole zoo, you will leave satisfied and awed.
destinations.tickets:
Entry Fee: 
	Rs. 50 per Adult
	Rs. 30 per Child
	Still Camera: Rs.100
	Video Camera: Rs.100

destinations.name: Osman Sagar Lake
destinations.description: Also known as Gandipet, Osman Sagar Lake is an excellent picnic spot located on the outskirts of Hyderabad. Irrespective of whether it is summer or winter, this place is bursting with visitors. The cool breeze and soothing ambience adds to the serene environment. Boating facilities are also provided.

destinations.name: Paigah Tombs
destinations.description: The Paigah tombs are among the major wonders of Hyderabad State which known for their architectural excellence as shown in their laid mosaic tiles and craftsmanship work. With marvelous carvings and motifs in floral designs and inlaid mosaic tile-works, the tombs are exquisite to walk around. The tombs and their walls are delicately carved and enclosed in pierced marble facades, some of them in rows and some with beautifully carved screens and canopies.

destinations.name: Peddamma Temple
destinations.description: This temple is one of the most revered temples of Hyderabad. Located in Jubilee Hills, this temple hosts the Bonalu Festival every Sunday. The main deity worshipped is Ammavaru, who is seen as the mother and saviour of all.

destinations.name: Qutb Shahi Tombs
destinations.description: The Qutb Shahi Tombs are located in the Ibrahim Bagh, close to the famous Golconda Fort in Hyderabad, India. They contain the tombs and mosques built by the various kings of the Qutb Shahi dynasty.

destinations.name: Ramoji Film City
destinations.description: Ramoji Film City is an integrated film studio complex located in Hyderabad. Spread over 1666 acres, it is the largest integrated film city in the world and as such has been certified by the Guinness World Records as the largest studio complex in the world. It was built by Telugu film producer Ramoji Rao in 1996. Ramoji Film City is the best place for some family time, fun and rides.
destinations.tickets: Based on the package you take

destinations.name: Salar Jung Museum
destinations.description: The Salar Jung Museum is an art museum located at Dar-ul-Shifa, on the southern bank of the Musi River in the city of Hyderabad, Telangana, India. It is one of the three National Museums of India. Originally a private art collection of the Salar Jung family, it was endowed to the nation after the death of Salar Jung III.

destinations.name: Shilparamam
destinations.description: Shilparamam is a must-see place when in
destinations.tickets:
Rs. 40 for Adults
Rs. 20 for Children

destinations.name: Shri Jagannath Temple
destinations.description:
This temple is a replica of the original Jagannath Temple of Puri, Odisha. Though it's smaller, it's design resembles the original. The main idols of the temple are Lord Krishna along with his brother Bala Rama and sister Subhadra.
Fun Fact: Jagan means Universe and Nath refers to Lord.

destinations.name: Wonderla Amusement Park
destinations.description: The Wonderla Amusement Park is the loudest, craziest, and the most amazing part of town. This simply is not just an amusement park in Hyderabad, but a world of breath-taking charm. It's a place to celebrate the smaller moments and share big wonders.

destinations.name: Bhadrachalam Temple
destinations.description: Famous for sharing a historical significance with the Ramayana Era, it is believed that the idols present in the temple are self-manifested ones. The town is synonymous to the temple devoted to Lord Ram and Goddess Sita. Lord Ram's birthday and marriage anniversary are celebrated in Bhadrachalam lavishly and many people from all over India come to pay homage.

destinations.name: Khammam Fort
destinations.description: Located in the heart of Khammam, the fort is surrounded by a huge rock wall. The fort has 10 gates and the main entrance, known as Khilla Darwaza, is around 30-foot tall. It has two cannons on either side of the entrance. The east gate or the secondary entrance is equally large and known as Raathi Darwaza. Depicting architecture of both Muslim and Hindu reigns, Khammam Fort has recently completed 1000 years of existence and is a major landmark.

destinations.name: Kinnerasani Wildlife Sanctuary
destinations.description: The wide-stretching area serves as the home for many endangered species. This wildlife sanctuary actually gets it's name from the picturesque Kinnerasani River, which divided the sanctaury and meets the Godavari River. Visitors are most likely to see Panthers, Tigers, Hyenas, Jungle Fowl, Quails and the list goes on. Bird-watching, Boating and Safari are some of the activies offered here. The best time to visit is between June and October. Fun Fact: The river has been used in many Telugu songs and poems.

destinations.name: Palair Lake
destinations.description: Palair Lake is a man made lake and a major source of freshwater in the Khammam district of Telangana, India. The lake is a balancing reservoir for the Lal Bahadur Canal, a left bank canal of the Nagarjuna Sagar project. Put your swimming gear on because water based adventure sports and recreational facilities are also there. Fun Fact: Electrical power is also generated using Palair reservoir water.
destinations.tickets: Prices may vary for water activities

destinations.name: Bhongir Fort
destinations.description: Spread across an area of 50 acres, The Bhongir Fort stands 500 feet tall, over the top of an enormous rock formation. This fort witnessed the glorious rule of Queen Rudramadevi and is said to be connected to Golconda Fort, 50 kilometers away, in Hyderabad. After scaling to the top, you can observe a panoromic view of the entire region. Visitors can also find an impressive collection of armory, stables, trap doors and other tools of historical interest. The fort also has a Hanuman temple and many ponds at the hilltop.
